isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC), Orifice Tube System, Pre-March 2007 - 3200, 4100, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500, 8600 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - AIR CONDITIONER (EVAPORATOR) HOUSING

note.para: Refer to Figure 29 while performing the following steps.

step1.para: Discharge the A/C system. Refer to DISCHARGING THE SYSTEM .
If necessary, remove right side splash panel. Refer to HOOD, GRILLE, and FENDERS section in GROUP 09- FRONT END SHEET METAL in the Master Service Manual.

Remove cowl drain tray/HVAC air inlet. Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, COWL DRAIN TRAY/HVAC AIR INLET
.
If the air cleaner is mounted in front of the evaporator housing, perform steps 5 and 6; otherwise, proceed to step 7.
Disconnect air tube and all wiring from engine air cleaner housing.
Remove engine air cleaner mounting bracket from the cowl.

figure.caption: Figure 29. Evaporator Housing (Shown with Cowl Tray Removed)

step1.para: Disconnect wiring connector to actuator motor (2) for fresh/recirc air door (damper).
Disconnect wiring to thermistors (6 and 8) and cut plastic wire ties to allow the connectors to be moved out of the way.
Unclip or remove clamps securing orifice line and condenser-to-evaporator line (4) to evaporator housing (3).
Disconnect end of orifice line (5) connected to evaporator inlet fitting.
Unclip clamps (10) and/or wire ties securing accumulator-to-compressor line (9) to cowl.
Disconnect end of accumulator-to-compressor line from accumulator (7).

note.para: Refer to Figure 30 while performing the following steps.

step1.para: Remove the four nuts securing the evaporator housing (1, Figure 30) to the mounting studs on the cowl.
Carefully remove evaporator housing from the cowl.

note.para: Perform only the following steps that are required to transfer parts to a replacement housing or to replace defective parts within the removed housing.

step1.para: To remove accumulator (8), disconnect end of evaporator-to-accumulator line (9) connected to evaporator outlet (suction) fitting; then, remove two accumulator mounting bolts (7).
To remove recirc door actuator (4), remove two screws securing the actuator to evaporator housing (1).
Remove drain tubes (5) from the evaporator housing.

caution.para: While separating the evaporator housing be careful not to damage the fins or fittings on the evaporator core.

note.para: Before separating the evaporator housing, the old mounting gasket should be removed and discarded.

The housing halves normally snap together and are secured with one screw (hi-lo thread); however, mounting tabs are provided to allow assembling the halves with additional hi-lo thread screws if the plastic snaps are damaged during disassembly. The mounting tabs are designed specifically to use only hi-lo thread screws.

figure.caption: Figure 30. Evaporator Housing Mounting and Components

step1.para: Separate the housing halves by removing one or more hi-lo thread screws, releasing the snap tabs, and pulling the halves straight away from each other.

To replace the evaporator core (6) refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, EVAPORATOR CORE
.

To replace the fresh/recirculate air door (damper) (3) refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, FRESH/RECIRCULATE AIR DOOR (DAMPER)
.

When replacing a defective evaporator housing (or housing half), transfer all of the good components (evaporator core, fresh/recirculate door, door actuator, and drain tubes) from the broken housing to the new housing.

note.para: Depending on the level of disassembly required for the repair, some of the following steps may not be necessary for each installation.
Refer to Figure 30 while performing the following steps.

step1.para:
If the system is to be flushed or purged, perform that operation before reassembling the system. Refer to PURGING OR FLUSHING THE AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM
.

To install the evaporator core (6) refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, EVAPORATOR CORE
.

To install the fresh/recirculate air door (3) refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, FRESH/RECIRCULATE AIR DOOR (DAMPER)
.

note.para: The housing halves normally snap together and are secured with one screw (hi-lo thread); however, mounting tabs are provided to allow assembling the halves with additional hi-lo thread screws if the plastic snaps are damaged during disassembly. The mounting tabs are designed specifically to use only hi-lo thread screws.

step1.para: Join the housing halves by using the snap tabs and one screw. If any of the snap tabs have been damaged, use additional hi-lo thread screws in the molded joining tabs to securely join the halves.

caution.para: In the following step, never force the actuator drive collar into position. If the drive collar position must be changed, follow the following procedures. Forcing the drive collar may result in a broken actuator.

step1.para: Install the fresh/recirculate air door actuator (4) by aligning the flats on the door shaft with the actuator hub, if possible. Secure the actuator with two screws. If alignment is necessary:

step2.para: Place the actuator into its approximate position.
Connect a 9 Volt battery across pins A and F of the actuator connector, to rotate the drive collar. (Reverse the connection to rotate the drive collar in the opposite direction.)
Allow the drive collar to rotate until it is aligned with the door shaft, and the actuator mounting screws can be inserted. Then, disconnect 9 Volt battery.

step1.para: Install the drain tubes (5).
Loosely mount the accumulator (8) to the evaporator housing assembly by placing it into position and threading the two mounting bolts (7) into their holes. Do not tighten.

note.para: Always lubricate O-rings on fittings with mineral-based oil during installation.

step1.para: Using a new O-ring and C-plate connect end of evaporator-to-accumulator line (9) to outlet (suction) fitting of evaporator core. Tighten to 20,000 ±1000 N.mm (180 ±10 lbf-in).
Tighten the two accumulator mounting bolts (7).
Using a new gasket/seal (2), install evaporator housing (1) onto the mounting studs located on the cowl using four nuts. Tighten to 6500 N.mm (57.5 lbf-in).

note.para: Refer to Figure 29 while performing the following steps.
Always lubricate O-rings on fittings with mineral-based oil during installation.

step1.para: Using a new O-ring and C-plate connect end of accumulator-to-compressor line (9, Figure 29) to accumulator. Tighten to 20,000 ±1000 N.mm (180 ±10 lbf-in).
Using a new O-ring and C-plate connect end of orifice line (5) to evaporator inlet fitting. Tighten to 20,000 ±1000 N.mm (180 ±10 lbf-in).
Connect wiring to thermistors (6 and 8) and secure wires using plastic wire ties.
Connect wiring connector to actuator motor (2) for fresh/recirc air door (damper).
Secure accumulator-to-compressor line (9) to cowl using hose clamps (10).
Secure orifice line (5) and condenser-to-evaporator line (4) to evaporator housing (3) using hose clamps.
If the air cleaner was mounted in front of the evaporator housing, perform steps 18 and 19; otherwise, proceed to step 20.
Install engine air cleaner mounting bracket to cowl.
Connect air tube and wiring to engine air cleaner housing.

Install cowl drain tray/HVAC air inlet. Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, COWL DRAIN TRAY/HVAC AIR INLET
.
Install right side splash panel, if previously removed.

Recalibrate the fresh/recirc air door by disconnecting the HVAC control panel assembly for at least 15 seconds. Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL, HVAC CONTROL PANEL ASSEMBLY
.
Recharge the system. Refer to:
